page.title: 04MADE IN DEANSTON
page.content: Deanston Distillery was once a thriving cotton mill where most of the villagers worked. This closed in 1965 & later Invergordon Disterilleries took over to make a malt whisky called Deanston Mill. About 18-20 people were employed then. As the whisky industry declined production ceased and the distillery became mainly a warehouse from which in-store whisky is sent out to blenders. Now the workforce is reduced to 6. However a by-product of the distillation is made by Doune Products Ltd. Pot Ale, a residue from the first distillation, is brought in from producing distilleries to make Pot Ale Syrup for animal feeding. This is the only work now carried out apart from storing whisky. The water supply which once drove the mighty mill wheel now powers the alternator generating more than adequate inhouse electricity
